title: 622-C
statement: C. Not Equal on a Segmenttime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given arrayawithnintegers andmqueries. Thei-th query is given with three integersli,ri,xi.For thei-th query find any positionpi(li≤pi≤ri) so thatapi≠xi.InputThe first line contains two integersn,m(1 ≤n,m≤ 2·105) — the number of elements inaand the number of queries.The second line containsnintegersai(1 ≤ai≤ 106) — the elements of the arraya.Each of the nextmlines contains three integersli,ri,xi(1 ≤li≤ri≤n, 1 ≤xi≤ 106) — the parameters of thei-th query.OutputPrintmlines. On thei-th line print integerpi— the position of any number not equal toxiin segment[li,ri]or the value- 1if there is no such number.ExamplesInput6 41 2 1 1 3 51 4 12 6 23 4 13 4 2Output26-14

processed.result:
You are given an array of $n$ integers and $m$ queries. Each query consists of three integers $l$, $r$, and $x$. For each query, find any position $p$ within the segment $[l, r]$ such that the element at position $p$ is not equal to $x$. If no such position exists, print $-1$.

**Input:**

* The first line contains two integers $n$ and $m$ ($1 \le n, m \le 2 \cdot 10^5$) representing the size of the array and the number of queries, respectively.
* The second line contains $n$ integers $a_i$ ($1 \le a_i \le 10^6$) representing the elements of the array.
* Each of the next $m$ lines contains three integers $l$, $r$, and $x$ ($1 \le l \le r \le n$, $1 \le x \le 10^6$) representing the parameters of a query.

**Output:**

* Print $m$ lines, where the $i$-th line contains an integer $p$ representing the position found for the $i$-th query, or $-1$ if no such position exists.

You are given a list of numbers and a set of queries. Each query asks you to find a number within a specific range of the list that is different from a given value. If no such number exists, output -1.
